trial_identification.studytitle: A prospective, single-masked, cross-over, randomised clinical trial assessing ocular comfort and ocular changes with and without lens replacement during the day with AIR OPTIX (trademark) AQUA contact lenses worn by experienced wearers over three days
trial_identification.scientifictitle: A prospective, single-masked, cross-over, randomised clinical trial assessing ocular comfort and ocular changes with and without lens replacement during the day with AIR OPTIX (trademark) AQUA contact lenses worn by experienced wearers over three days

interventions.interventions: This is a prospective, single-masked, cross-over, randomised clinical trial, with participants wearing AIR OPTIX AQUA contact lenses bilaterally over 3 days following initial lens dispense. Participants will initially be fitted with contact lenses . This is followed by three days of wear with the same lens type. Each day corresponds to one stage of the study. For two of the stages, participants will insert their own study lenses and these will be removed after approximately five hours of wear. Either the same lenses will be re-inserted after a brief soak in saline or a new pair of lenses will be inserted. For the other stage, participants will insert their own study lenses and wear the same lenses for the day without removal. The order in which this occurs will be randomised for all stages and masked when lenses are removed during the day. Subjective responses will also be evaluated at regular intervals during each stage. It is expected that most participants will have six scheduled visits, comprising the baseline visit followed by two stages with two visits per stage and one stage with one visit. * Baseline visit * Stages where lenses removed during the day o Visit 1 o Visit 2 * Stage where lenses not removed during the day: o Visit 1 * Take home questionnaires (THQ) at regular intervals during the day for all stages

primaryOutcome.outcome: Subjective ocular comfort with contact lenses. This will be assessed by using questionnaires which are to be completed at regular time points during the day.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Ocular response. This will assessed with a slit lamp biomicroscope, which is a specialised micrsocope used to view the eye.

fundingsource.fundingaddress: Level 5, North Wing, Rupert Myers Building (RMB), Gate 14, Barker Street, The University of New South Wales SYDNEY NSW 2052

ethicsAndSummary.summary:
The aim of this trial is to assess changes in ocular comfort during the day, and whether ocular comfort is influenced by new lens replacement or re-insertion with the same lens after a brief soak in saline, during the day. The trial also aims to assess ocular changes and whether these correlate with changes in comfort.
The hypothesis for this trial is ocular comfort will decrease with lens wear during the day whether lenses are replaced, the same lens is re-inserted or the same lens is worn uninterrupted for the day.
ethicsAndSummary.publication: Papas EB, Tilia D, Tomlinson D, Williams J, Chan E, Chan J, Golebiowski B. Consequences of wear interruption for discomfort with contact lenses Optom Vis Sci. 2014 Jan;91(1):24-31

ethicscommitee.ethicname: The Vision CRC and Institute for Eye Research Human Ethics Committee
